Parameters:

Returns:

Cleans up a URL, because Java doesn't like URLs with spaces in them

Parameters:

Returns:
the URL with %20's instead of spaces

stringWithPlural

public static java.lang.String stringWithPlural(java.lang.String string,
                                                int quantity)
Returns the given string with an "s" at the end if the quantity is present. stringWithPlural("dog", 5) -> "dogs" Warning: doesn't take into account unusual endings (curse you, English.) "child" would become "childs" :(

Parameters:
string - some sort of noun that can be counted
quantity - the number of things there are of the string
Returns:
the string + "s" if there's anything but 1, the original string only if there's only 1

Parameters:
text - the advice (can be HTML)
Returns:
the created JPanel

                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                   boolean visible)
Uses a JEditorPane to open the given URL in a dialog

Parameters:
url - the url to load
title - the title of the dialog
frame - the parent frame
visible - true if you want the dialog to be visible, false if you want it to be invisible to user

openURLinDialog

public static void openURLinDialog(java.lang.String url,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String iconPath,
                                   javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                   boolean visible)
Uses a JEditorPane to open the given URL in a dialog

Parameters:
url - the url to load
title - the title of the dialog
frame - the parent frame
visible - true if you want the dialog to be visible, false if you want it to be invisible to user
iconPath - the path to the image icon for the dialog.

drawEmblem

public static void drawEmblem(javax.swing.JComponent component,
                              java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws an emblem (based on current theme) in the bottom left of the given component. Call this in paintComponent() of the component.

Parameters:
component - the component to draw on
g - the Graphics object from paintComponent()

putPanelInDialog

public static javax.swing.JDialog putPanelInDialog(javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                                                   javax.swing.JFrame owner,
                                                   java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                                   java.lang.String iconPath,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height)
Utility method to put the given panel in a JDialog. You'll have to show it on your own.

Parameters:
panel - the panel to put in a dialog
owner - the JFrame that owns the dialog
dialogTitle - the title for the dialog
iconPath - the path to the dialog's icon, such as foo.png
width - the dialog's width. Pass -1 to pack().
height - the dialog's height. Pass -1 to pack();
Returns:
the JDialog the panel is in

public static void showDialog(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                              java.lang.String whatToSay,
                              java.lang.String title)
Creates and shows a dialog.

Parameters:
frame - the parent frame. Can be null.
whatToSay - the body of the dialog.
title - the title of the dialog.
iconPath - the icon's name (x.png)

iconPath - the icon's name (x.png)
